abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Second Programmatic
            Financial Sector Adjustment Loan Project is to lend
            continued support to the comprehensive financial sector
            reform program pursued by the authorities and supported by
            the World Bank through a first programmatic loan in 2001,
            and its recently expanded sectoral reform agenda. through
            its support for a strengthened financial system, the loan
            will help anchor poverty reduction in Brazil with
            sustainable, sound, and crisis-dampening economic growth, as
            well as directly aiding poverty alleviation through enhanced
            access to financial services. This loan supports sustained
            progress in all reform areas covered in the first
            programmatic operation and gives particular recognition to
            accelerated implementation of major and difficult financial
            sector reforms, beyond the scope of the first programmatic
            operation (report no. P7448). Areas covered include:
            progress concerning program actions to enhance access to and
            raise efficiency in financial intermediation, to promote
            banking system soundness and prevent financial crises, to
            improve governance, and reduce systemic payments risks, as
            well as major restructuring of federal banks, and
            privatization of state-owned public banks. The loan also
            covers the passage/submission of major legal reforms
            pertaining to the financial sector.
